pullRequest.title: corrected track_total_hits docs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Here's how track_total_hits behaves for me.
$ curl "https://my_es_cluster.wherever.net/standard_production_v1-0000004/_search?timeout=250ms"  | jq .hits.total.value
10000

$ curl "https://my_es_cluster.wherever.net/standard_production_v1-0000004/_search?timeout=250ms&track_total_hits=true"  | jq .hits.total.value
384255594

commit.message:
corrected track_total_hits docs

Here's how `track_total_hits` behaves for me.
```
$ curl "https://my_es_cluster.wherever.net/standard_production_v1-0000004/_search?timeout=250ms"  | jq .hits.total.value
10000

$ curl "https://my_es_cluster.wherever.net/standard_production_v1-0000004/_search?timeout=250ms&track_total_hits=true"  | jq .hits.total.value
384255594
```

nodes.bodyText:

            If `true`, exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
          
          
            
            If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -315,8 +315,8 @@ the scores are not used for sorting. Defaults to `false`.
 (Optional, integer or boolean)
 Number of hits matching the query to count accurately. Defaults to `10000`.
 +
-If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned. If `false`, the response does not
-include the total number of hits matching the query.
+If `true`, exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
